newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Chess-Oslo, Donetsk lead World Cities chess tie in Jakarta.
newsitem.headline: Chess-Oslo, Donetsk lead World Cities chess tie in Jakarta.

text.p: The top seeds took control of the World Cities Championship in Jakarta with Oslo and Donetsk holding a slender lead after Thursday's fourth round.
The powerful Ukrainian team from Donetsk demolished the top Indonesian team, Jakarta, but Oslo also kept pace, as the Norwegians completed a poor day for the local teams by beating Depok Margonda.
"It could have been even better," said a delighted International Master Berge Ostenstad after scoring one of Norway's two victories in round four.
"I think we had chances to win both games which were drawn - but 3-1 is fine," he added.
Lurking just behind these two are the top seeds, Moscow, who had to fight hard for their 3-1 victory over Ho Chi Minh City.

One of the reasons for Moscow's slow start has been that their - and the event's - top player, Grandmaster Alexander Onischuk, has yet to show top form, drawing his first four games against far lower ranked opponents.
Unfancied Filipino team Mandaluyung, who inflicted Moscow's only loss in the second round, continue to impress, in this round massacring the undermanned Depok Beji to remain level with Moscow.
The major upset of the fourth round was the loss by Sydney to the Jakarta A team. After a solid start, Sydney have lost their past two matches and seem to be out of contention for the major prizes.

Gunadarma World Cities Championship, Jakarta Results of Round 4: Oslo (NOR) def Depok Margonda(INA) 3-1 Moscow (RUS) def Ho Chi Minh (VIE) 3-1 Donetsk (UKR) def Jakarta (INA) 3.5-0.5 Mandaluyung (PHI) Depok Beji (INA) 3.5-0.5 Bandung (INA) def Palu (INA) 3.5-0.5 Jakarta A (INA) def Sydney (AUS) 3.5-0.5 Tashkent (UZB) def Depok Kelapa (INA) 3-1 Ambon (INA) def Medan (INA) 3-1 Rango on (BRM) def Jakarta Women (INA) 4-0 Yogyakarta (INA) def Kuala Lumpur (MAS) 2.5-1.5 Mandalay (BRM) drew with Bontang (INA) 2-2 Raffles City (SIP) def Jakarta B (INA) 2.5-1.5 Sentosa (SIP) def Victoria (SEY) 2.5-1.5 Bogor (INA) def Kuching (MAS) 2.5-1.5 Hong Kong (CHN) def Noumea (NCL) 2.5-1.5 Leading scores after four rounds: 1eq. Oslo, Donetsk 12; 3eq. Moscow, Mandaluyung 11.5; 5eq. Bandung, Jakarta A 11; 7eq
